intro: Leichhardtia kaalaensis, commonly known as the Kaalaense Leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
